title: I am trying to ID this font, I hope someone can help me
content:
Hi Guys,

This has been a real pain trying to ID this font, any help you guys can give will be great. Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120325222549im_/http:/typophile.com/files/header_5755.jpg)
author: bellard

comments.content:
Check the Techno\>Scifi category at Dafont. I don't have time now myself, but this is where I think you can find it.

- Mike Yanega
I have found some fonts that are close but not spot on (thanks Mike), still looking for this font.

I checked MyFonts and found this Ray Larabie font called [Vipnagorgialla](http://web.archive.org/web/20120325222549/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/vipnagorgialla/). Try to say that three times fast!

It's not identical, but maybe it's close enough to get what you want with some tweaks.

- Mike Yanega

Close enough, Mike you rock! Thanks man.

- David Bellard

The "S" and other glyphs from Ray Larabie's font are different than on the image.  
I think it's "NokianvirallinenkirjasinREGULAR":

[http://www.urbanfonts.com/fonts/NokianvirallinenkirjasinREGULAR.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20120325222549/http:/www.urbanfonts.com/fonts/NokianvirallinenkirjasinREGULAR.htm "http://www.urbanfonts.com/fonts/NokianvirallinenkirjasinREGULAR.htm")

The font under there is Bolt Bold:

[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/itc-bolt/bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120325222549/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/itc-bolt/bold/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/itc-bolt/bold/")

Have a nice day!

Kind regards,  
Martijn van Berkel
